meanings.sent1: The fireworks will detonate in the sky tonight.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to detonate the firecrackers too close to the house.
meanings.sent3: The prankster tried to detonate a water balloon on his friend's head.
meanings.sent4: The news of the scandal seemed to detonate across social media.
meanings.sent5: The volcano's eruption caused the mountain to detonate in a fiery display.

meanings.sent1: He will detonate the dynamite to clear the rocks from the path.
meanings.sent2: The demolition expert will detonate the old building tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally used too much yeast, causing the bread to detonate in the oven.
meanings.sent4: The detective's discovery would detonate the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's experiment was a success when he managed to detonate the chemical reaction.
